moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 a6 6. f3
comment:
A Grischuk pet-line.
The young Muscovite wants to play the English Attack without having to worry
about the crucial, crunch-line, 6 ..Ng4 - the Kasparov Variation.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 a6 6. f3 Qb6
comment:
If Black wants to avoid going into the English Attack, then this is the way
to do it -despite the fact that your opponent has a 100% score of 4/4 against
this; including a win over Shirov in the semifinal of FIDE World Championship
KO in New Delhi recently.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 a6 6. f3 Qb6 7. Nb3 e6 8. Qe2 Qc7
comment: With Be3 coming, the queen was going to have to move anyway.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 a6 6. f3 Qb6 7. Nb3 e6 8. Qe2 Qc7 9. g4 b5 10. Be3 b4 11. Na4 Nbd7
comment:
The scene is set: White is looking to exploit the queenside,
Black is staking his claim in the centre.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 a6 6. f3 Qb6 7. Nb3 e6 8. Qe2 Qc7 9. g4 b5 10. Be3 b4 11. Na4 Nbd7 12. Qc4 Qxc4 13. Bxc4 d5 14. exd5 Ne5 15. Be2 Nxd5 16. Bd4 Bd6 17. Bc5 Be7 18. a3 a5 19. Bd4
comment:
I think by now Kasparov was regretting he hadn't placed the bishop on c7 -
White's no worse here.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 a6 6. f3 Qb6 7. Nb3 e6 8. Qe2 Qc7 9. g4 b5 10. Be3 b4 11. Na4 Nbd7 12. Qc4 Qxc4 13. Bxc4 d5 14. exd5 Ne5 15. Be2 Nxd5 16. Bd4 Bd6 17. Bc5 Be7 18. a3 a5 19. Bd4 f6 20. Nac5 O-O 21. O-O bxa3 22. Rxa3 Nf4 23. Bb5 Rb8 24. Bxe5 Nh3+ 25. Kg2 Rxb5 26. Bg3 Ng5 27. Bf2 Bb7
comment: There's no-way back for Grischuk now.
